Description: Flat polisher made of white quartz in an oval ground shape. Both sides well smoothed with one side a bit better furnished. The upper- and underside are slightly convex, forming a lentoid section. Therefore a use as a palette doesn’t seem plausible, possible use as a polisher or other tool. On the edge several wear marks from a usage like hammering.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 155)
